abstract: To improve big banks’ reputations, William Dudley told bankers to focus less on searching for “bad apples” than on overhauling their companies’ culture.
snippet: To improve big banks’ reputations, William Dudley told bankers to focus less on searching for “bad apples” than on overhauling their companies’ culture.
lead_paragraph: A prominent Wall Street regulator on Thursday continued to press senior bankers to clean up the culture of their firms so that they can avoid the sort of recent scandals that have undermined the reputations of big banks.

headline.main: New York Fed Chief Calls for Improved Wall Street Culture

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
